segment.source: Set up School PCs app technical reference
segment.target: Set up School PCs app technical reference

segment.source: Describes the changes that the Set up School PCs app makes to a PC.
segment.target: Describes the changes that the Set up School PCs app makes to a PC.

segment.source: Technical reference for the Set up School PCs app (Preview)
segment.target: Technical reference for the Set up School PCs app (Preview)

segment.source: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.
segment.target: [Some information relates to pre-released product which may be substantially modified before it's commercially released.

segment.source: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.
segment.target: Microsoft makes no warranties, express or implied, with respect to the information provided here.

segment.source: The Set up School PCs app helps you set up new Windows 10 PCs that work great in your school by configuring shared PC mode, available in Windows 10, version 1607.
segment.target: The Set up School PCs app helps you set up new Windows 10 PCs that work great in your school by configuring shared PC mode, available in Windows 10, version 1607.

segment.source: Set up School PCs also configures school-specific settings and policies, described in this topic.
segment.target: Set up School PCs also configures school-specific settings and policies, described in this topic.

segment.source: If your school uses Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) or Office 365, the Set up School PCs app will create a setup file that connects the computer to your subscription.
segment.target: If your school uses Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) or Office 365, the Set up School PCs app will create a setup file that connects the computer to your subscription.

segment.source: You can also use the app to set up school PCs that anyone can use, with or without Internet connectivity.
segment.target: You can also use the app to set up school PCs that anyone can use, with or without Internet connectivity.

segment.source: The following table tells you what you get using the Set up School PCs app in your school.
segment.target: The following table tells you what you get using the Set up School PCs app in your school.

segment.source: Each student can sign in and start using the computer in less than a minute, even on their first sign-in.
segment.target: Each student can sign in and start using the computer in less than a minute, even on their first sign-in.

segment.source: The apps students need are pinned to Start, and unnecessary apps are removed.
segment.target: The apps students need are pinned to Start, and unnecessary apps are removed.

segment.source: This option sets up computers for common use.
segment.target: This option sets up computers for common use.

segment.source: Anyone can use the computer without an account.
segment.target: Anyone can use the computer without an account.

segment.source: Settings specific to education create a useful learning environment and the best computer performance.
segment.target: Settings specific to education create a useful learning environment and the best computer performance.

segment.source: The computers are joined to your Azure AD or Office 365 subscription for centralized management.
segment.target: The computers are joined to your Azure AD or Office 365 subscription for centralized management.

segment.source: By signing on with student IDs, students have fast access to Office 365 web apps.
segment.target: By signing on with student IDs, students have fast access to Office 365 web apps.

segment.source: Student user and application settings data can be synchronized across devices for a personalized experience.
segment.target: Student user and application settings data can be synchronized across devices for a personalized experience.

segment.source: Note: If your school uses Active Directory, use Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer to configure your PCs to join the domain.
segment.target: Note: If your school uses Active Directory, use Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer to configure your PCs to join the domain.

segment.source: You can only use the Set up School PCs app to set up PCs that are not connected to your traditional domain.
segment.target: You can only use the Set up School PCs app to set up PCs that are not connected to your traditional domain.

segment.source: If your school uses Azure AD, configure your directory to allow devices to join.
segment.target: If your school uses Azure AD, configure your directory to allow devices to join.

segment.source: If the teacher is going to set up a lot of devices, give the teacher appropriate privileges for joining devices or make a special account.
segment.target: If the teacher is going to set up a lot of devices, give the teacher appropriate privileges for joining devices or make a special account.

segment.source: Office 365, which includes online versions of Office apps plus 1 TB online storage and Microsoft Classroom, is free for teachers and students.
segment.target: Office 365, which includes online versions of Office apps plus 1 TB online storage and Microsoft Classroom, is free for teachers and students.

segment.source: Sign up your school for Office 365 Education.
segment.target: Sign up your school for Office 365 Education.

segment.source: If your school has an Office 365 Education subscription, it includes a free Azure AD subscription.
segment.target: If your school has an Office 365 Education subscription, it includes a free Azure AD subscription.

segment.source: Register your free Azure AD subscription.
segment.target: Register your free Azure AD subscription.

segment.source: After you set up your Office 365 Education tenant, use Microsoft School Data Sync Preview to sync user profiles and class rosters from your Student Information System (SIS).
segment.target: After you set up your Office 365 Education tenant, use Microsoft School Data Sync Preview to sync user profiles and class rosters from your Student Information System (SIS).

segment.source: Shared PC mode helps ensure that computers are always up-to-date.
segment.target: Shared PC mode helps ensure that computers are always up-to-date.

segment.source: If a PC is configured using the Set up School PCs app, shared PC mode sets the power states and Windows Update to:
segment.target: If a PC is configured using the Set up School PCs app, shared PC mode sets the power states and Windows Update to:

segment.source: Forcibly reboot if necessary to finish applying updates
segment.target: Forcibly reboot if necessary to finish applying updates

segment.source: The PC is also configured to not interrupt the user during normal daytime hours with updates or reboots.
segment.target: The PC is also configured to not interrupt the user during normal daytime hours with updates or reboots.

segment.source: Guidance for accounts on shared PCs
segment.target: Guidance for accounts on shared PCs

segment.source: We recommend no local admin accounts on the PC to improve the reliability and security of the PC.
segment.target: We recommend no local admin accounts on the PC to improve the reliability and security of the PC.

segment.source: When a PC is set up in shared PC mode, accounts will be cached automatically until disk space is low.
segment.target: When a PC is set up in shared PC mode, accounts will be cached automatically until disk space is low.

segment.source: Then, accounts will be deleted to reclaim disk space.
segment.target: Then, accounts will be deleted to reclaim disk space.

segment.source: Both Azure AD and Active Directory domain accounts are managed in this way.
segment.target: Both Azure AD and Active Directory domain accounts are managed in this way.

segment.source: Any accounts created through Start without an account will also be deleted automatically at sign out.
segment.target: Any accounts created through Start without an account will also be deleted automatically at sign out.

segment.source: On a Windows PC joined to Azure Active Directory:
segment.target: On a Windows PC joined to Azure Active Directory:

segment.source: By default, the account that joined the PC to Azure AD will have an admin account on that PC.
segment.target: By default, the account that joined the PC to Azure AD will have an admin account on that PC.

segment.source: Global administrators for the Azure AD domain will also have admin accounts on the PC.
segment.target: Global administrators for the Azure AD domain will also have admin accounts on the PC.

segment.source: With Azure AD Premium, you can specify which accounts have admin accounts on a PC using the Additional administrators on Azure AD Joined devices setting on the Azure portal.
segment.target: With Azure AD Premium, you can specify which accounts have admin accounts on a PC using the Additional administrators on Azure AD Joined devices setting on the Azure portal.

segment.source: Local accounts that already exist on a PC won’t be deleted when turning on shared PC mode.
segment.target: Local accounts that already exist on a PC won’t be deleted when turning on shared PC mode.

segment.source: However, any new local accounts created by the Start without an account selection on the sign-in screen (if enabled) will automatically be deleted at sign-out.
segment.target: However, any new local accounts created by the Start without an account selection on the sign-in screen (if enabled) will automatically be deleted at sign-out.

segment.source: If admin accounts are necessary on the PC
segment.target: If admin accounts are necessary on the PC

segment.source: Ensure the PC is joined to a domain that enables accounts to be signed on as admin, or
segment.target: Ensure the PC is joined to a domain that enables accounts to be signed on as admin, or

segment.source: Create admin accounts before setting up shared PC mode, or
segment.target: Create admin accounts before setting up shared PC mode, or

segment.source: Create exempt accounts before signing out.
segment.target: Create exempt accounts before signing out.

segment.source: The account management service supports accounts that are exempt from deletion.
segment.target: The account management service supports accounts that are exempt from deletion.

segment.source: An account can be marked exempt from deletion by adding the account SID to the registry key.
segment.target: An account can be marked exempt from deletion by adding the account SID to the registry key.

segment.source: To add the account SID to the registry key using PowerShell:
segment.target: To add the account SID to the registry key using PowerShell:

segment.source: Shared PC mode is fully compatible with custom images that may be created by IT departments.
segment.target: Shared PC mode is fully compatible with custom images that may be created by IT departments.

segment.source: Create a custom image and then use sysprep with the flag to create an image that teachers can then apply the Set up School PCs provisioning package to.
segment.target: Create a custom image and then use sysprep with the flag to create an image that teachers can then apply the Set up School PCs provisioning package to.

segment.source: The Set up School PCs app produces a specialized provisioning package that makes use of the SharedPC configuration service provider (CSP).
segment.target: The Set up School PCs app produces a specialized provisioning package that makes use of the SharedPC configuration service provider (CSP).

segment.source: Saving content locally to the PC is disabled.
segment.target: Saving content locally to the PC is disabled.

segment.source: This prevents data loss by forcing students to save to the cloud.
segment.target: This prevents data loss by forcing students to save to the cloud.

segment.source: A custom Start layout and sign in background image are set.
segment.target: A custom Start layout and sign in background image are set.

segment.source: Prohibits Microsoft Accounts (MSAs) from being created.
segment.target: Prohibits Microsoft Accounts (MSAs) from being created.

segment.source: Prohibits unlocking the PC to developer mode.
segment.target: Prohibits unlocking the PC to developer mode.

segment.source: Prohibits untrusted Windows Store apps from being installed.
segment.target: Prohibits untrusted Windows Store apps from being installed.

segment.source: Prohibits students from adding new provisioning packages.
segment.target: Prohibits students from adding new provisioning packages.

segment.source: Prohibits student from removing existing provisioning packages (including the one set by Set up School PCs).
segment.target: Prohibits student from removing existing provisioning packages (including the one set by Set up School PCs).

segment.source: Sets active hours from 6 AM to 6 PM.
segment.target: Sets active hours from 6 AM to 6 PM.

segment.source: Sets Windows Update to update nightly.
segment.target: Sets Windows Update to update nightly.

segment.source: Important: It is not recommended to set additional policies on PCs configured with the Set up School PCs app.
segment.target: Important: It is not recommended to set additional policies on PCs configured with the Set up School PCs app.

segment.source: The shared PC mode has been optimized to be fast and reliable over time with minimal to no manual maintenance required.
segment.target: The shared PC mode has been optimized to be fast and reliable over time with minimal to no manual maintenance required.

segment.source: Prevent enabling lock screen slide show
segment.target: Prevent enabling lock screen slide show

segment.source: Prevent changing lock screen and logon image
segment.target: Prevent changing lock screen and logon image

segment.target: Select the Power button action (plugged in)

segment.target: Select the Power button action (on battery)

segment.target: Select the Sleep button action (plugged in)

segment.target: Select the lid switch action (plugged in)

segment.target: Select the lid switch action (on battery)

segment.target: Require a password when a computer wakes (plugged in)

segment.target: Specify the unattended sleep timeout (plugged in)

segment.target: Specify the unattended sleep timeout (on battery)

segment.target: Allow standby states (S1-S3) when sleeping (plugged in)

segment.target: Specify the system hibernate timeout (plugged in)

segment.target: Admin TemplatesSystemPower ManagementVideo and Display Settings

segment.source: Hide entry points for Fast User Switching
segment.target: Hide entry points for Fast User Switching

segment.source: Turn off app notification on the lock screen
segment.target: Turn off app notification on the lock screen

segment.source: Allow users to select when a password is required when resuming from connected standby
segment.target: Allow users to select when a password is required when resuming from connected standby

segment.source: Block user from showing account details on sign-in
segment.target: Block user from showing account details on sign-in

segment.source: Prevent the usage of OneDrive for file storage
segment.target: Prevent the usage of OneDrive for file storage

segment.source: Allow users to log on using biometrics
segment.target: Allow users to log on using biometrics

segment.source: Allow domain users to log on using biometrics
segment.target: Allow domain users to log on using biometrics

segment.source: Admin TemplatesWindows ComponentsData Collection and Preview Builds
segment.target: Admin TemplatesWindows ComponentsData Collection and Preview Builds

segment.source: Toggle user control over Insider builds
segment.target: Toggle user control over Insider builds

segment.source: Show lock in the user tile menu
segment.target: Show lock in the user tile menu

segment.source: Open a new tab with an empty tab
segment.target: Open a new tab with an empty tab

segment.source: Interactive logon: Do not display last user name
segment.target: Interactive logon: Do not display last user name

segment.source: Interactive logon: Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart
segment.target: Interactive logon: Sign-in last interactive user automatically after a system-initiated restart

segment.source: Shutdown: Allow system to be shut down without having to log on
segment.target: Shutdown: Allow system to be shut down without having to log on

segment.source: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users
segment.target: User Account Control: Behavior of the elevation prompt for standard users

segment.source: Use Set up School PCs app
